item.title: 津巴布韦 ZiG 法案促使废除股票市场的归属规则
item.description: 津巴布韦新货币 ZiG 的稳定性促使当局废除了自 2022 年起实施的一项规定，该规定要求津巴布韦主要证券交易所的投资者持有股票 180 天，否则将面临缴纳更高的资本利得税的风险。【原文：The stability of Zimbabwe’s new currency, the ZiG, has prompted authorities to scrap a rule in place since 2022 that requires investors on its main bourse to hold onto stocks for a period of 180 days or risk paying a higher capital gains tax.】

item.title: 亿万富翁大亨卡洛斯-斯利姆的投资公司披露持有英国电信 3.2% 的股份
item.description: 亿万富翁卡洛斯-斯利姆（Carlos Slim）的家族投资公司披露持有英国电信公司英国电信集团（BT Group Plc）3.2%的股份，该公司新任首席执行官在过去一个月里扭转了股价下跌的趋势，并提高了股息。【原文：Billionaire Carlos Slim’s family investment firm has disclosed a 3.2% stake in UK telecommunications company BT Group Plc, whose new chief executive officer has reversed share declines and boosted the dividend in the past month.】

item.title: 特斯拉向欧盟施压，要求降低从中国运入的电动汽车关税
item.description: 特斯拉公司要求欧盟对其电动汽车征收低于其他从中国运入欧盟的汽车制造商的关税，理由是特斯拉受益于较少的国家支持。【原文：Tesla Inc. has asked the European Union to subject its electric vehicles to a lower tariff rate than other manufacturers shipping cars into the bloc from China, arguing that it’s benefitted from less substantial state support.】

item.title: 在 Elabe 选举民调中，马克龙党团的支持率为 18%，勒庞党团的支持率为 31
item.description: 周三公布的投票意向民意调查显示，玛丽娜-勒庞领导的极右翼政党国民联盟将以 31% 的支持率赢得法国立法选举第一轮投票，而埃马纽埃尔-马克龙领导的政党将以 18% 的支持率位居第三。【原文：The far-right National Rally party of Marine Le Pen would win the first round of the French legislative election with 31%, while President Emmanuel Macron’s party would come in third with 18%, according to a poll of voting intentions published on Wednesday.】

item.title: MSCI 拒绝将欧盟债务纳入政府债券指数的计划
item.description: 摩根士丹利资本国际公司（MSCI Inc.【原文：MSCI Inc. has decided it won’t add debt sold by the European Union to its range of government bond indexes, in a blow to the bloc’s quest to attract a larger pool of investors.】

item.title: 壳牌将成为 Pavilion Energy LNG 资产的领跑者
item.description: 壳牌公司（Shell Plc）已成为收购贸易公司 Pavilion Energy Pte 资产的主要竞标者，这项交易将加强这家超级巨头的液化天然气业务。【原文：Shell Plc has emerged as the lead bidder to buy assets of trading firm Pavilion Energy Pte, in a deal that will bolster the supermajor’s liquefied natural gas activities.】

item.title: 卡特彼勒提高季度派息并加强股票回购计划
item.description: 卡特彼勒公司将其股息提高了约 8%，并在其股票回购计划中增加了 200 亿美元，因为该公司以生产标志性黄色重型机械而闻名的部门表现强劲。【原文：Caterpillar Inc. hiked its dividend by about 8% and added $20 billion to its share buyback program after seeing strong performance from its division best known for making iconic yellow heavy-duty machinery.】

item.title: 安哥拉就价值 35 亿美元的炼油厂向 Quanten 发出最后通牒
item.description: 安哥拉威胁称，如果无法筹集到项目资金，将终止与美国Quanten LLC集团的合同，该集团将在非洲国家建设一座耗资35亿美元的炼油厂。【原文：Angola has threatened to terminate a contract with U.S.-based group Quanten LLC to build a $3.5 billion oil refinery in the African country if it fails to raise the funds for the project.】

item.title: 法国保守党在领导人与极右翼势力达成协议后将其驱逐出境
item.description: 法国保守派共和党领导人一致同意开除其主席埃里克-西奥蒂，因为他在临时立法选举前宣布与极右翼达成了协议。【原文：The leaders of France’s conservative Republicains agreed unanimously to expel their president, Eric Ciotti, after he announced a pact with the far right ahead of the snap legislative election.】

item.title: 凯雷的桑德拉-霍巴赫担任重要收购部门的主席职务
item.description: 华尔街最杰出的女性之一桑德拉-霍巴赫（Sandra Horbach）正在让出凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：Sandra Horbach, one of Wall Street’s most prominent women, is ceding day-to-day leadership atop a key Carlyle Group Inc. private equity arm.】

item.title: 回收服务公司 Gopher Resource 正与私人信贷机构洽谈融资事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，回收服务提供商 Gopher Resource 因资金周转困难，已向私人信用贷款机构寻求融资。【原文：Gopher Resource, a provider of recycling services, has reached out to private credit lenders for financing as it struggles with liquidity, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 交易商杰拉德集团称遭遇 4900 万美元的锡欺诈案
item.description: 大宗商品贸易公司 Gerald Group 称，它支付了近 4900 万美元购买锡，但结果发现这并不是锡。【原文：Commodity trading house Gerald Group said it paid almost $49 million for tin that turned out not to be tin.】

item.title: 风险公司找到 14 亿美元武器对抗鹰派美联储
item.description: 杠杆贷款市场的重新定价浪潮正在帮助高风险公司应对美联储发出的 "长期走高 "的信息。【原文：A repricing wave in the leveraged loan market is helping risky companies cope with the “higher for longer” message from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 挪威政府因首席执行官薪酬问题陷入冲突
item.description: 在一些重要企业拒绝上限后，挪威政府坚持了限制国有企业高管薪酬的立场。【原文：Norway’s government held onto its stance on limiting executive pay in state-owned companies after some key firms refused caps.】

item.title: 卢拉发表有关财政平衡的言论后巴西市场下挫
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）在参议院否决了其政府关于增加公共收入的最新提案后，巴西市场下挫，加剧了人们对财政问题的担忧。【原文：Brazilian markets sank as President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva added to growing fiscal jitters just after the Senate shot down his government’s latest proposal to boost public revenue.】

item.title: 布拉德称 CPI 数据显示 "无懈可击的通货紧缩 "已成现实
item.description:

item.title: 欧洲央行行长金多斯称 "巨大 "不确定性导致 2024 年利率路径开放
item.description: 欧洲中央银行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）说，欧洲中央银行今年不能预先承诺做出任何决定，因为它要面对波动的通胀和难以预测前景的经济。【原文：The European Central Bank can’t pre-commit to any decisions this year as it confronts volatile inflation and an economy whose outlook is difficult to predict, Vice President Luis de Guindos said.】

item.title: 即使进军纺织业，Suzano 仍对更多并购交易持开放态度
item.description: 全球最大的木浆出口商苏扎诺公司（Suzano SA）正在大肆收购，其高级财务主管表示，公司没有放慢脚步的计划。【原文：The world’s top wood pulp exporter, Suzano SA, is in the midst of a buying spree — and its top finance executive says it doesn’t have plans to slow down.】

item.title: 安德鲁-勒夫在筹集最新现金后大胆做空 GameStop
item.description: 安德鲁-莱夫特（Andrew Left）平仓了他对 GameStop 公司的大胆空头头寸，因为在过去的一个月里，这家meme-stock 公司筹集了 30 亿美元，使其资本充足，股价飙升。【原文：Andrew Left closed out his gutsy short position against GameStop Corp. as the meme-stock company raised $3 billion in the past month, leaving it well capitalized and with a soaring share price.】

item.title: 两家伦敦对冲基金巨头据称将探索阿布扎比前哨基地
item.description: 伦敦最大的两家对冲基金正在考虑在阿布扎比开设办事处的计划，以巩固该市作为新兴金融企业中心的地位。【原文：Two of London’s biggest hedge funds are considering plans to open offices in Abu Dhabi, bolstering the city’s status as an emerging hub for financial firms.】

item.title: Stifel 与 Lord Abbett 成立最新私人信贷合伙公司
item.description: Stifel Financial Corp.和 Lord Abbett & Co.将联手成立一家私人信贷合资企业，这是投资银行和传统资产管理公司之间的最新合作，双方都试图在这一价值 1.7 万亿美元的资产类别中分得更大一杯羹。【原文：Stifel Financial Corp. and Lord Abbett & Co. are teaming up on a joint venture for private credit, the latest partnership between investment banks and traditional asset managers as both try to grab a bigger slice of the growing $1.7 trillion asset class.】

item.title: 电动汽车领导者挪威不会跟随欧盟对中国电动汽车征收关税
item.description: 挪威财政大臣特里格夫-斯拉格沃尔德-韦杜姆（Trygve Slagsvold Vedum）表示，挪威作为插电式汽车的先驱，不会加入欧盟对中国电动汽车增加关税的行列。【原文：Norway, a trailblazer in the uptake on plug-in vehicles, won’t join the EU’s increase in tariffs on Chinese electric cars, Finance Minister Trygve Slagsvold Vedum said.】

item.title: 阿布扎比阿德诺克公司（Adnoc）启动其最大的液化天然气出口终端项目
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国最大的能源公司批准了一个大型液化天然气出口终端，以开拓日益增长的全球燃料市场。【原文：The United Arab Emirates’s biggest energy company approved a major liquefied natural gas export terminal as it seeks to tap into a growing global market for the fuel.】

item.title: 加文-纽森希望遏制一项让企业损失 100 亿美元的劳动法
item.description: 二十年来，加州的一项法律帮助工人起诉了世界上最大的公司。优步技术公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：For two decades, a California law has helped workers sue the world’s biggest companies. Drivers for Uber Technologies Inc. won a $20 million settlement, Google employees secured $27 million over complaints of free-speech violations, and Walmart Inc. agreed to pay $65 million for allegedly not providing seating to their cashiers.】

item.title: 贝莱德在推进私人债务业务中寻找保险合作伙伴
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc.’s private-debt business is exploring ways to tap the deep pockets of insurance companies that are increasingly looking to boost their allocations to the asset class.】

item.title: 美银美林的苏布拉马尼安认为股市形势 "不错
item.description: 在反对者担心利率长期维持高位可能导致经济放缓之际，美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的萨维塔-苏布拉马尼安（Savita Subramanian）表示，经济前景良好，这一背景将继续利好美股。【原文：As naysayers fret over a potential slowdown from the prospect of interest rates remaining elevated for longer, Bank of America Corp.’s Savita Subramanian says the economy looks good, a backdrop that will continue to bode well for US stocks.】

item.title: 布林肯称哈马斯的停火要求意味着战争仍将继续
item.description: 国务卿安东尼-布林肯（Antony Blinken）说，哈马斯要求对停火建议进行几处修改，这超出了该组织以前的立场，使人们对很快达成协议的可能性产生了新的怀疑。【原文：Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Hamas demanded several changes to a cease-fire proposal that go beyond the group’s previous stance, casting fresh doubt about the chances for a deal anytime soon.】

item.title: 为了新经济，银行和民间信贷需要合作
item.description: 德意志银行欧洲、中东和非洲地区资本市场联席主管霍比-布瓦特（Hoby Buvat）在接受彭博电视采访时表示，投资银行需要与私人信贷合作，以满足新经济（包括数字化和去碳化）所需的大量资本支出。【原文：Investment banks will need to work with private credit in order to satisfy the massive capital expenditure requirements for the new economy including digitization and decarbonization, said Hoby Buvat, co-head of capital markets EMEA at Deutsche Bank, speaking on Bloomberg TV.】

item.title: 在冷淡的 CPI 数据公布后，交易员充分预期美联储 11 月降息
item.description: 在一份报告显示 5 月份通胀意外放缓后，交易员们重新开始全面预计美联储将在 11 月份降息，并预计今年将降息两个季度。【原文：Traders resumed fully pricing in a Federal Reserve interest-rate cut in November, expecting two quarter-point reductions this year, after a report showed inflation unexpectedly slowed in May.】

item.title: 尼日利亚番茄枯竭给通胀带来新风险
item.description: 尼日利亚番茄价格飙升，令正在与几十年来最高的粮食通胀率作斗争的政府当局感到新的头痛，这引发了抗议和抢劫。【原文：Soaring tomato prices in Nigeria are creating a new headache for authorities, who are battling food inflation that’s at its highest in decades and has fanned protests and looting.】
